      public FileBuffer(String path) throws IOException
      Creates FileBuffer object with given path; Initializes FileHolder object and retrieves its FileHolder.getContent()
      Throws:
      IOException

  • Method Details

    • enterInsertionPoint

      public void enterInsertionPoint()
      Inserting a line separator can only be done with bytes.

    • write

      public void write(byte updatedContents)
      Updates the content of the FileBuffer

    • save

      public final int save()
      Saves the buffer contents to disk

    • moveCursor

      public void moveCursor(char direction)
      Moves the cursor in a given direction. 'C': right 'D': left 'A': up 'B': down

    • getInsertionPointLine

      public int getInsertionPointLine()
      Returns the Y coordinate where the insertion point should be rendered.

    • getInsertionPointCol

      public int getInsertionPointCol()
      Returns the X coordinate where the insertion point should be rendered.

    • getByteContent

      public ArrayList<Byte> getByteContent()
      Returns a copy of the byteConent of this FileBuffer

    • getLines

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Byte>> getLines()
      Returns an array of byte arrays. Each array represents an array of bytes which is separated by another array by a line separator specified in TextR.getLineSeparatorArg().

    • deleteCharacter

      public void deleteCharacter()
      Deletes the character before the insertionPointByteIndex and updates the cursor position

    • getFileHolder

      public FileHolder getFileHolder()
      Returns the FileHolder object file (for testing purposes)

    • getAmountChars

      public int getAmountChars()
      Returns the amount of chars in the buffercontent

    • getInsertionPoint

      public int getInsertionPoint()
      Returns the insertion point.

    • getDirty

      public boolean getDirty()
      Determines if the buffer has been modified.

    • clone

      public FileBuffer clone()
      Clones this object
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object

    • equals

      public boolean equals(FileBuffer buffer)
      Checks if the given FileBuffer references the same FileHolder and temporarily, if the content, and dirty boolean match.

    • close

      public int close()
      Warns the user if the dirty is set to true and prompts the user to save the FileBuffer. When done, it will remove the FileBufferView linked to this object.
      Returns:
